Reviews.Title: “Small but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jndantas
Reviews.Content: Not sure if the hotel itself is worth the money, but the location is unbeatable - safe area, less than 5 minutes away from both the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. Big restaurant and shopping area nearby. There's an Air France shuttle bus that takes you directly from or to Orly or Charles de Gaulle for 11 euros that leaves from the Arch. You can walk from the Arch (metro station Charles de Gaulle-Étoile) to the hotel, it will take you 5-10 minutes. Small rooms, very big bathrooms. Nice bed, free wifi and the free mini bar means you have 5 drinks and a pack of chips every 3 days. Staff not that friendly except for the night shift man, who spoke with me in french, spanish and english. Breakfast just like the hotel - small but ok. Juice, tea, coffee and milk; bread, buns and croissants, butter, cheese, ham and jam; eggs, bacon and sausages. Stayed there because I got a prize for that hotel, but wouldn't stay there if I had to pay it myself. Rate: 6,5/10

Reviews.Title: “Average - great location but thats it”
Reviews.Author: Mrchris11
Reviews.Content: Very average. Paying purely for location. Room was very compact. What makes this 4 star rather than 3 is the dubious vinegary 'champagne' on welcome (had to be asked for) the free mini bar. Water and crisps. And the afternoon tea. Didn't go. If staying for 1-2 nights I'd find a charming B&B to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “lucky find”
Reviews.Author: member007England
Reviews.Content: Having decided to drive to Paris and stay in the Champs Elysée , i did not realise that i would have so much fun on THAT roundabout and having gone round twice for fear of crashing and to confirm my exit , i did get into the Champs Elysee. The next problem was parking but as i drove down the one way streets i somehow saw a space and parked up somewhat relieved! I walked around and into several 5* hotels that all seemed to have snooty receptionists . Not going to part with my money with them. Walked into the Freidland hotel which is where i had parked closest and they were smiley and courteuse . They showed me a room overlooking the avenue and i spent 4 wonderful nights here. The rooms were very comfortable and i slept very well. Breakfast was plentyful and all the staff very freindly. This hotel is a great base for exploring this romantic and beautiful city and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A sensible hotel in Paris - Zut Alors!”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews I had read in tripadvisor and because of its location - close to meetings. The rate was under 200 Euros and I was stunned to learn on my arrival that they offered: A welcoming glass of Champagne Free buffet breakfast (which was quite decent - much more than a continental) Free soft drinks in the mini-bar A tea-time buffet FREE WI-FI !!! and some other stuff. My room was small but well laid out and if you spend anytime in your hotel room while in Paris - you are a loser (unless you are traveling with someone and are overcome with the romance of the city). The Wi-Fi worked well and was as fast as any I have used in a hotel. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Diamond_Diz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to its rating on tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. The service from start to finish was outstanding, particularly from Theo on the front desk, who could not do enough for us and was incredibly good at his job.. We had a long day trawling the sites of Paris and it was wonderful to return to the hotel and be greeted by a 'tea time buffet', which lasts until 8.30pm. The bed was incredibly comfy and our room was nice, decorated in a typically French style. All in all the vibe that was created at this hotel by its staff made us feel really at home and comfortable, and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly and polished hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMD1962
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from start to finish. Helpful, friendly staff, clean and modern and within a very short distance of the Champs Elysees. Very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Zurichparis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business travel 2 nights - very friendly welcome and nice amenities like free softdrinks in the room and free wifi. My room rate was also very reasonable and included breakfast which is a nice buffet in the morning. Room is clean - a bit cramped up but fully renewed bathroom. Only downside is the poor quality of room service dinner - I suspect they are using same caterer as in other Paris hotels I stayed before which serves really poor quality (cold meals only) and takes up to one hour to get into your room - for a business traveler this may be a showstopper. However for a tourist trip the location is definitely excellent and you will enjoy the many good restaurants in this neighbourhood !!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamon68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on new years eve. The hotel is located a 5 min. walk from the Champs Elysees and metrostation George V but in a far more quiet area compared to the busy crowds of the Champs Elysees. Although we arrived two hours before official check in time, our room was ready. The room was very charming and clean and even had a view of the Arc de Triomphe. Nice touches are the friendly staff, the teatime snack buffet, the complimentary glass of champaign, free wifi and the free use of the minibar with softdrinks. Breakfast was decent and offered a good variety. There were some little flaws however. The minibar was not cooled and the AC in our room didn't work either. Both didn't really bother us, but would have if it had been summertime. I would definitely consider staying here again on a next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD LOCATION AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: IreneAthens
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days. The hotel's location is excellent and safe. The rooms are very convenient compared to Paris standards. The service is also very good. What made a real difference is that the hotel offers free glass of champagne upon arrival, snacks during tea time (during 5:30 - 7:30 p.m. daily), free non-alcohol drinks and bottled water daily. I recommend this hotel for both business and leisure trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: WonderWomann
Reviews.Content: This small chain hotel is located near the Arch of Triumph, a 5 min walk to Champs Elysees if you take the adjacent road called Rue Washington. This is among the several Best Westerns all over Paris, in fact there are several others that are closer walk to Champs Elysees so if this is the only consideration then you may consider booking in one of those. The front desk are nice enough the guy gave us a map but not but overly helpful in terms of advise on getting around, for first timers we needed a little more help and perhaps asked them but they were a little brisk though not really rude. Also although they confirmed they had booked us an airport shuttle, the person on duty the next day when we checked out said it had not been booked and we were forced to take a cab to the airport which was very expensive from the hotel- about 40 mins with no traffic. The hotel has free wifi and an internet point where you can surf free for the first hour. The room is small with a small balcony and good enough for 2 by European standards. The sheets, towels, bathroom were all nice and clean. Our main complain was the safe in our room did not work and although we repeatedly requested it was neither fixed nor changed, it simply did not feel safe to leave our cash in a stapled envelope in the reception as they suggested. The breakfast was very basic- bread, eggs, bacon, some fruits and croissant- no cappuccino. They may consider upgrading it as most tourists like to have a full breakfast as they are rushed to sightsee all day long. They did have a tea time buffet but we did not have time to check it out. The good thing about the hotel was the minibar was free- although it had no alcohol- just water, soda and chips its quite uncommon and a nice gesture by the hotel for weary tourists with no supermarket nearby. In addition they also had in room free tea/coffee ingredients and good toiletries. The AC worked well too. To summarize- its a good deal for its price range in Paris with a great location but don’t expect much help from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice by far in Paris for location and service”
Reviews.Author: PMRKM
Reviews.Content: When booking everything is promised and here more than what we expected was given. We loved everything. Hotel staff was very friendly and super helpful. Looking forward to our next visit to relax and enjoy. WOW

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with many amenities!!”
Reviews.Author: beintem
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a 10 day trip to Paris and we decided to stay at this hotel, and we are so glad we did!!! We had reserved the superior room, which was plenty big enough for the both of us and we also had our son (who lives in France) come stay with us for a few nights, with plenty of room. The room was very clean. Every other day, the staff filled our mini fridge with chips, soda and water, which was a very nice touch. In the morning they served a buffet breakfast, complete with eggs, bacon, sausage, breads, toast, cheeses, juices, coffee, tea and pastries and fruit. Another added bonus is their afternoon tea that is served from 530 pm to 830pm......they serve 2 kinds of pasta salads, breads, cheeses, tea and 2 kinds of tarts...very yummy!! The staff all spoke English and they were all very helpful in helping us find places or retrieve tickets. I would definitely come back to stay here. Wear good walking shoes, the subway is about 5 blocks away......but we were ok with that.....we love to walk!! The taxi curb is right across the street which is very convenient as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: J Michael T
Reviews.Content: 5 people, 3 rooms. Small rooms but comfortable and quiet, with full length French windows to small balconys. Showers had good water pressure and plenty of hot water. An ottoman and armchair meant we could still get together in one room in the evening. Just off Avenue Friedland and short walk to Arc de Triomphe and Metro. Breakfast was filling with healthy choices and free beverages in the room mini bar fridge were a very welcome addition. I think it was supposed to be non-smoking but people did smoke out their windows which crept in to our rooms in the morning - not pleasant. Overall very good value for money. Staff had excellent command of English and were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice and well-located hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: TexasTrue
Reviews.Content: Very friendly/helpful hotel staff and a lovely room. Our room was wonderfully light and airy located with a great view of the streets below and the bustling activity--yet well soundproofed so there was no disturbance to us from the traffic. Beds were comfortable and housekeeping very competent and accommodating. Breakfast was not lavish but certainly sufficient with wonderful pastry and coffee in a pretty, quiet room on the ground floor. Numerous cafes and restaurants nearby, all of which were suberb and reasonably priced. I would certainly recommend this hotel and stay here again on a future trip!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: newfylady
Reviews.Content: Very cute hotel with 2 meals a day helping budget immensely.staff good with good italian restaurant reccomendation.bathroom excellent size, free bedroomupgrade and lovely frenchbalcony.highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nigh on perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a trip to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary and for us, it was just about perfect. The location, only 500m from the Arc De Triomphe, is ideal and it was easy to walk to many of the major attractions such as the Trocadero, Eiffel Tower and Louvre. The superior room we booked was comfortable with air conditioning, a nice firm bed (why don't more hotels use firmer beds?!), TV, fridge / mini bar (very welcome) and a good size bathroom. Having a free WiFi link in your room is a bonus as it meant we could keep in touch with home without racking up major mobile costs. The staff spoke English (but also helped us with our French) and dealt with any requests pleasantly and promptly. The hotel provides a nice breakfast option of sausage, bacon and scrambled eggs with the usual toast, pastries and fruit etc to set you up for the day. In the evening there is a tea time buffet of breads, cold meats, pasta, cous sous etc which was welcome after a day walking around the city. It was nice to have a nibble here before venturing off to find a cafe / restaurant for a main meal ... and watch the Parisian world go by. All in all, we loved this hotel and it goes to show that you don't need to spend a fortune to be in a nice place and get great service. The Hotel Champs-Elysees Friedland would be our first choice on any return trip to Paris; it is that good!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel. Wouldn't come back.”
Reviews.Author: ricardogeh
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and the air conditioning goes To your head, but it is clean and the location is fairly good. I think it could be closer to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Friendly Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hallux62
Reviews.Content: There were hundreds of Hotels I contacted while arranging our whirlwind tour of Paris. Understanding that the hotel rooms in Europe are smaller than in the US I knew we needed 2 rooms for myself my wife and our 3 teenage children. The days of sharing one room were over. With the weak dollar I was also looking to get the most bang for our buck. I was able to arrange 2 rooms one with a queen bed and the other room had a queen and a roll-a-way which my daughter said was very comfortable all for a reasonable rate. We arrived via Eurostar and as soon as we got off the train we were like fish out of water. With only my high school French to guide me we managed to find the information desk in the Gard Du Nord station. We purchased a 3 day metro pass so we were able to hop on and off the metro all day long, including busses. I suggest, the bus from the train station which takes you directly to the hotel. We were not aware of this and wound up dragging our luggage on the metro. As we exited the metro station we were at the Arc de triumph with is an amazing site as you come up from the metro. The Hotel is about a 1/4 mile down Friedland on the left hand side. We checked in at 4. Everyone who worked at the frontdesk was extremely helpful and were eager to reccomend places to eat. They gave us maps of the city. We had breakfast included in our room rates. The breakfast was plentiful and about what you would expect for a European continental morning meal. The hotel had an afternoon snack / meal which was ok but we are vegetarians and alot of what they served had some sort of meat in it. The location of the Hotel is perfect. The elevators a little clostrophobic for even 2 people. We chose to walk up and down as often as we could, except when we needed to bring luggage up and down. We had superior rooms which I believe are a little bigger than the standard rooms, but it was worth the extra money. The hotel was well kept and clean. I would reccomend staying here again on our next trip to paris. Contact the front desk direct to see if you can get the best rate and if travelling with children of any ages, let them know because they were very accomodating. After we checked out they held our luggage for us until we returned as we wanted to get in every last minute in Paris we could. We then took the bus back to the Gare Du Nord station which took about 20 minutes. One last piece of info. Everyone we met and interacted with in Paris were nice and helpful, but you need to try and speak some French first. If the parisians think you are just expecting them to speak Englsih just because you think everyone should speak English; this is not happeneing. I always attempted to try and speak some French first, pulled out my english-french dictionary and once they saw that I was struggling, immediately helped me in English.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied overall and would return”
Reviews.Author: chrismEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 nights stay at this hotel. Paid £150 per night, which for Paris was reasonable I guess. Compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Paris it was certainly better, but then it was more expensive. The hotel is well situated only a few hundred yards from the Arc De Triomphe/ Champs-Elysees, which makes everything reasonably accessible, whether that be on foot, by bus or by taxi. The rooms are comfortable, a decent size and are reasonably well decorated. The staff were fairly attentive although I found that the majority didn't speak much English. I do speak French though so this didn't cause me any problems. We were fortunate in that the weather was excellent during our stay but although happy with the room we initially had when we checked in, the air conditioning didn't work and after a sleepless first night due to the intense heat, I spoke to reception in the morning. To be fair to the receptionist, he came to my room to look at the air conditioning and when he was unable to get it to work he immediately offered me an alternative room, which was a slight upgrade from the one we already had. The hotel offers a decent breakfast and on the day we checked out they were happy for us to store our luggage for as long as we needed them to, which was really helpful as we had a late return flight. The problem with the air conditioning didn't put me off this hotel, although maybe we were fortunate that there was a room available for us to move to, and by Paris standards it was good accommodation and I would certainly stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: AlisonS32
Reviews.Content: A good location, quiet but close to all the action on the Champs Elyesse

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - very kind staff”
Reviews.Author: Leese25
Reviews.Content: I booked the Eurostar & hotel through Lastminute.com and was so pleased about the price, I was worried this might not be a nice hotel! Eurostar journey was smooth and as we exited the station we were AMAZED that there was no-one in the queue for taxis!!! This is because Paris is very quiet in August. SO much so, the cab fare was at least Euro 10 less than to a similar journey made in December. We arrived earlier earlier than the advertised room availability but was pleasantly surprised when we were told the room was ready. I was sharing the room with my daughter for two nights, so the wardrobe was very large with plenty of hangers. Nice flat screen tv (mostly news English speaking channels), tea/coffee facilities. Great view and excellent secondary glazing to stop 99% of street traffic noise. The aircon was amazing - very much needed as the temperature outside far exceeded 30 degrees. Everything was perfectly clean. Lovely sheets and towels. The only minus was that we felt it would have been a great help if the bathroom had an extractor fan - not a huge complaint. My daughter was VERY pleased that the hotel offered free wifi. The free afternoon tea was lovely as there was a little buffet laid out in the breakfast room which you could help yourself to. Breakfast buffet was nice. The room was large enough to accommodate guests with plenty of space. Hot food available was scrambled eggs, very salty bacon and sausages. Boiled eggs were also on offer. There was every conceivable tea as well as coffee, apple juice, orange juice, grapefruit juice and water. You could make your own toast or have a croissant. Plenty of butter and a choice of jams. We found the staff to be helpful and professional and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: wigley01
Reviews.Content: A good choice for our 1st visit to Paris. This was a perfect position for the purpose of our trip 'Tour de France' with the added bonus of being close to the tourist sights. Our room was nicely decorated and spotless. A good variety for breakfast with an added bonus of a early evening buffet, all included in the price. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location--great value!”
Reviews.Author: Jamarho
Reviews.Content: My husband, parents, and I stayed at the Best Western Etoile Friedland Champs-Elysees, which is just a short walk from the Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe, for two nights in July, 2011. I found the hotel on Trip Advisor and made reservations based on the reviews. The stay exceeded our expectations. We had two superior rooms, one on the 4th floor and one on the 6th floor. The room on the 6th (top) floor had a slanting wall on one side as it was under the eaves, and the 4th floor room seemed to have a little more space. However, both were quite comfortable and large enough for American travelers, and both had very nice updated bathrooms. The service was excellent. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Included with our room were a glass of champagne, breakfast each morning, and tea each evening. We ate a nice lunch in Paris each day and then had tea for our evening meal. You may take your own bottle of wine to evening tea or purchase a bottle reasonably from the hotel. Each room had wine glasses and a corkscrew available, as well as a minibar that was stocked free of charge with soft drinks, water, and snacks. We definitely would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lisaohler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are on the small side BUT very clean and quiet. Breakfast was included along with an late afternoon tea that was very substantial. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a hotel that really values their customers!”
Reviews.Author: stugs123
Reviews.Content: We arrived and was greated by a very warm welcome by the staff at reception. They were so happy to see us and was so polite (which is a bonus whist in Paris!) Rooms were spacious (again a big bonus) and clean. Noise from outside wasn't a problem as they have double glass doors but if you kept it open, it could get a bit noisy with normal traffic noise. Breakfast and Afternoon tea was sufficient and free (another bonus!) . Mini bar was stocked every three days but it's free. (more bonus!) The staff at reception was so helpful, arranging taxis and tours over the weekend for us. Its a hotel that keeps on giving!! ohh and wifi was also free!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ED7707
Reviews.Content: Excelent Hotel, great location, friendly staff We were traveling with an 1 year old baby and everybody was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with a Very good Location”
Reviews.Author: mrabedin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located although it may be a little hard to locate at first. It is a block away from the very well known street Champs Elysées. The street is full of well known stores such as louis vuitton, lacoste, zara, etc. The hotel has very good restaurants around it as well depending on your budget. The breakfast was ok although there is a french guy at front desk during the day who is really rude and arrogant. So in overall prespective, everything about this hotel is very good except the french guy at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel around the corner from the Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: BenPrairies
Reviews.Content: First stay at this hotel. Smallish (not unexpected) but comfortable room with large bed and good sized desk. Large washroom. Room was spotless. Afternoon soft drinks/coffee and appetizers provided in the breakfast area, part of the room rate. Good breakfast spread in the morning. Was given by the concierge an excellent restaurant recommendation, La Casita on Washington street, 5 min. walking from the hotel. All in all, a good experience at this hotel. Would I go back? Perhaps...but would also check around other alternatives in a similar price point.

Reviews.Title: “What a hidden find!”
Reviews.Author: BubbleDaisy
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel to stay in. A little hard to find though. It took us over an hour of walking around before we found it. We should have taken a cab (our own fault)! Once we did find it we couldn't believe how easy it was to get too. The hotel staff were so polite and engaging. Every time we came in from a time of sight seeing there was someone different at the front desk. But all of them were so helpful. We stayed in one of the upper rooms overlooking the street. The room was huge. The bathroom was huge and had a towel warmer and bathtub. We had two windows that were heavy duty and kept out the noise but were wonderful to open in the morning to hear Paris coming alive. The room was clean, the bathroom was in excellent condition. The internet was free and worked in our room. The hotel is very quiet which is nice when you have been out all day. Some of the best features of this hotel. It is very close to the Champs Elysees and the metro. They serve a complimentary continental breakfast that can be served in your room--so every morning we had breakfast in bed. A lovely array of croissants, breads, butters, jellies, yogurt, coffee, tea or hot chocolate. They also served a complimentary light dinner buffet at the Best Western just a minute walk down the road and across the street. This buffet included an assortment of cheeses, meats, breads, and pasta or vegetable dishes. It also came with either tea, water or juice. This saved us a ton of money. There is a pharmacy on the first floor of the building the hotel was in--that was convenient for toiletries. The lift was small but could fit me and my husband plus our backpacks. I have been in smaller in Paris. There is a small refrigerator in the room, two night stands next to the bed, a small writing table, and a TV. This hotel in not located in a part of Paris that has a lot of pedestrian only streets. These streets around the hotel stay pretty busy. So you won't find any specialty shops around, like cheese, meats, breads, or chocolates. You have to stay on a pedestrian only street to experience that. But just a short walk over to the Champs Elysees you will find many little delis and grocery stores. So we were able to stock up on cheeses, yogurt, and breads to take back to our room. I would definitely stay here again. It is a little pricey, but we wanted to splurge a bit our first few nights in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cdolan51
Reviews.Content: Very good location not far from Arc de Triomph and Champs Elysses. A little far from nearest Metro, around 500 meters, if you have a lot of bags. We caught a taxi from Gare du Nord for that reason. Only cost 15 Euro. Staff were excellent. Breakfast good and afternoon tea was also a great filler between excursions. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location and Fantastic Staff.”
Reviews.Author: thomboey76
Reviews.Content: We could not have had a nicer time in Paris and the hotel was FANTASTIC with any and all help we needed. The brand new breakfast and afternoon lunch room was great with a very nice American breakfast and lunch/dinner. We used the shuttle service the hotel provided for 34 euros and the driver took use to the airport with out a problem and was very nice to point out the sights as we left the City. The Hotel is in a perfect location to EVERYTHING. We had one of the big rooms with a balcony on the fifth floor #504 and I asked to have one of the three before we left and the hotel was happy to make sure I was in the room I wanted. They are the toupe and grey rooms. Not the blue rooms. There are floors for smokers and non smokers so if smoke bothers you make sure to let the hotel know you would like to have a non smoking floor. Well thats about all. Paris is wonderful. OH! Everyone of the staff speaks English so that will not be a problem. Also you can use their computer in the lobby for an hour for free. And remember all the meals and mini bar are FREE..... And if you have ever been to Europe FREE food is a wonderful PLUS! I hope this helps with anyones concerns

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel for the price and very close to train station”
Reviews.Author: Putush
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from May 6th with my husband and 4 year old son and really liked the hotel. First the pros: Djamel the guy at the reception is absolutely wonderful. He went out of his way to help us, give us directions, suggestions, advice on anything we asked for. We highly appreciate his help! Next, the room was huge by Parisian standards and was very comfortable. The view was great and although the breakfast was not as great as other reviews, since their breakfast room was under renovation and we had been given breakfast in our room every morning, still it was hearty and filling. Although, the choices were limited to croissants, bread, tea, coffee, juice still we couldn't complain and had a good time. Never used to the tea time buffet since were were out all day visiting the gorgeous city of Paris. The hotel was also very helpful in keeping our luggage for 2 days when we were away visiting Burgundy and when we returned to Paris, everything was perfect and we were given the same room we had requested. The only con was a receptionist in the evening whom we had asked for directions to Laduree in Champs Elysees and he told us off saying he was busy and would speak later. Also, never use the hotel phone since we had called a friend on cell in Paris and were charged tremendously for the call! But that is something we didn't know... The walk to train station is beautiful and there are many stations close by--like Charles du Gaulle Etoile, Ternes, George V. For the location and the comfortable accomodations, we would go back to this hotel again! Thanks for a memorable trip!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was fine until teh check-out”
Reviews.Author: ellycarter
Reviews.Content: Sophie at the front desk handled out check-out and cab was booked 30 minutes later than we asked for. She kept saying that she didn't do it, her colleague did it. She called/shout at me [--] in French. And told taxi company that "crazy people need taxi right now" in French. She didn't know we understand French and she had a priceless face when we spoke back to her in French. Horrible emotional person. I cannot believe the hotel hired such person and she still have the job with the attitute. Other staff members were all right and I was happy with my stay but with the person at check-out ruined everything. Seriously, she was the rudest person at hotels that I have encounter ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: sayush
Reviews.Content: I've been with my daughter for 8 days. The location could not be better. The room was very good, quite spacey and clean. At night you better close the windows as it is noisy but with the air-condition it is fine. The service is excellent, very polite and efficient. They speak English which helps. The Mini-Bar in the room is free, the breakfast and afternoon buffet is good. One can make coffee or tea in the room. The only thing I would change, as a woman, is a better light in the bath room or at the room for putting on make-up! It is important especially in Paris........We have really enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not mindful of basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: mrfoofram
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, decent location near Champs-Elysees, but it was an unseasonably warm week (nights in the mid-70s), and we had NO AC. Clerk who came to our room dismissively advised us to open the window - to a very noisy street that remained noisy thru much of the night. They also cut off room service 45 minutes before posted time in the menu, and insisted there was a minimum that was also nowhere in writing. won't be back anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel very polite staff a notch above other hotels”
Reviews.Author: msb223
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the HC-EF in April in a hectic 3 day city break in the city that I proposed to my wife 30 years ago. There is little to fault this hotel. The staff were always polite and no matter who was on the reception desk and no matter what time of day you would always get a nice bonjour or bon soir. The room was large for Paris and the bath room of generous proportions. Very clean and fairly quite considering the location. Managed to sleep soundly the bed was comfortable but considering what we did each day I think I would have slept well on the floor. Now the advantages of this hotel over others - Complimentary glass of champagne - although we didn't actually get round to it. The breakfast buffet covered all bases with limitless cooked food , continental breakfast, bread, croisent,cakes,cereal, yoghurts, toast and fruit accompanied by cofee tea and choice of fruit juices. The buffet tea served in the evening. Tried this one evening and although limited was great if you were on a budget or in our case having to leave home at 3 in the morning to catch our flight by 7 in the evening after a full days sightseeing- too tired to go out to eat. The free mini bar containing 4 500ml bottles of water / coke and two cans of fruit juice was a great touch to take with you when sightseeing. Free wirefire in all rooms or free internet use for an hour. In a lot of hotels looked at before booking a lot had none of the above, were of the same price, quality, and in the same area as the HC-EF. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: nana4chicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with my husband and adult daughters to celebrate our anniversary. We stayed here because of the great reviews it had on Travel Advisor. It was even better than we expected! The rooms were beautiful, clean, and comfortable. The breakfast was amazing, including eggs, bacon, sausage, rolls toast, cereals, fresh fruit--unbelievably good. The location is outstanding. We walked to the Champs Elysees, where the Metra and RER stations can take you all over Paris, quickly. We also walked in the opposite direction, to the Galleries Lafayette and the Opera. The staff was extremely helpful in making reservations for us, and making suggestions. We would definitely return and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Convenient,Quiet,Comfortable like a home”
Reviews.Author: lionheart-jcv
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at this hotel.Good location for Paris marathon start line on Champs-Elysees street.It takes about 5 minutes on foot. It is amazing. The room is comfortable for me, quiet, and clean. I had a good sleep.The breakfast is good.But, if more various range of food is available, it would be much better. A little sad to know there is no salad available. Tea time buffet is also good. But, again, more food would be fine for me.It is like a home, not a businesslike hotel.Unique atmosphere!! I like that.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: wendy-q8
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with our stay at the B.W. Champs Elysees Friedland. The location was good, about a 5 minute walk from the beautiful Arc De Triomphe and Champs Elysees. We really appreciated the breakfast offered everyday. Although it was a simple buffet; eggs, bacon, sausage, croissants, cereal and some fruits, it was satisfying and convenient. The hotel also offers an afternoon tea everyday from 5:30-8:30 and serves soft drinks and snacks. Free internet access was another plus as we were travelling with 2 teenagers. There was a gentleman working the front desk (wish I knew his name) who was extremely accomodating. We arrived at 8:30 a.m. and he did his best to get us in our rooms quickly. He was an excellent source for Paris information and was always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY AND DEPENDABLE”
Reviews.Author: GOLDENATHEANA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the 1990's and found the guest rooms nicely put together, modern bathrooms and great location. So, last year when traveling with my sister and extended family, I thought we would visit once again. It was wonderful to find that indeed the location is super and the rooms and bathrooms continue to be updated with the pasting years. Thoughtfully, the hotel has a free afternoon tea in their dining room. Personally, I think a more traditional tea would be more fitting in Paris, however, some travelers may like meat dishes as well. The point is, the staff made an effort for people with tired feet and bundles of maps under their arms - The breakfast in the dining room is just O.K. - That is one section that needs improving. The room service is a better choice. WiFi is in the lobby and I was able to use laptop in my room- I feel very safe at this hotel and the staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “definately the place to stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: rachelgandy
Reviews.Content: The deluxe rooms are fabulous,and the location was one road away from the champs elysee.the breakfast room is a little small but the food was very nice,the only negative was the noise from the traffic,but then it is central Paris!We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Pjrtrvl
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for us. The room was very comfortable the staff very helpful. Many extras that we appreciated such as free Internet, a good breakfast, and an evening lite buffet

Reviews.Title: “always my choose in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mundodama
Reviews.Content: Very charming and comfortable hotel. Is the second time I stayed there. Love the neighborhood and the building makes us feel like Parisians. Next year I return to stay at this hotel again. Very important: wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Class location.”
Reviews.Author: belfasttraveller2011
Reviews.Content: Just two minutes away from Arc de Triomphe, I found this little treasure through trip advisor. Great location. Breakfast Buffet and Afternoon Tea was great. Rooms very roomy by Paris standard. They very helpfully provided a baby cot for us. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hawthornden
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited our purposes well and provided reasonabley good value for money. The hotel was quiet with limited facilities, no restaurant and only a small, 'honesty' bar so if you want more than this then this hotel would not suit. Our room was adequate and clean although quite small. The location was fairly convenient, approximately five minutes walk to L'Arch de Triomphe and five to ten minutes to the Champs Elyses.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for city trip”
Reviews.Author: vdmeerenp
Reviews.Content: Me & my wife stayed in the hotel the weekend before Valentine's Day.The staff was very friendly and helpful.We were offered a glass of champagne and drinks in the minibar were for free. The location of the hotel is excellent, a few minutes walking to Arc De Triomphe and Champs Elysées, subway station Etoile nearby.Rooms were very clean. The fact that there is a (paying) public parking space (Friedland) nearby was also positive, since we came to Paris by car. Breakfast was also very varied, especially compared to French standards. Only remark I have is that the breakfast room is quite small, we had to wait for a few minutes before we could actually sit down somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly service rooms small but very adequate.”
Reviews.Author: JMichie
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for walks or public tspt. Only disapointment during our stay was that the French outplayed the Scots rugby team and deserved to win - but we will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: Laura-6543
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at this hotel. All the extras were great too. Our room was lovely and very warm, the staff were very helpful too. We will be sure to use this hotel when we next visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “very profecional service”
Reviews.Author: mike189400
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very well located and easy to walk for having dinner or even shopping. The stuff was very helpfull and the free offers, especially the minibar was something that I've seen for first time. I am very happy with my choise. Only negative was the lack of space in the breakfast area. Perhaps with different furniture (these were vey uncomfortable) the situation could improove

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LITTLE HOTEL NEAR CHAMPS ELYSEES”
Reviews.Author: YorbaLinda15
Reviews.Content: Just spent 12 nights at this hotel. Excellent desk staff; very helpful and accomodating. Good breakfast and late afternoon tea with appetizers. Room was smaller than expected. Included soft drinks in minibar.Short walk (10 min.) to metro and Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sammie19
Reviews.Content: Except finding our room door open one day everything was good, It seems the House Keeper forgot to close it all the way...didn't loose anything but a bit scary...the staff were very friendly and helpful. Location was good for Busses and few minutes walk from the Metro.....Breakfast and afternoon snacks are great ..except the breakfast egg seems a bit watery.....over all it is a nice Hotel....

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevebwa
Reviews.Content: Despite being affiliated with the Best Western hotel chain (which I think of as being very low-end), the Etoile Friedland is a charming and delightful hotel only 2 blocks from the Champs Elysees. We booked it as part of a flight and hotel package on Expedia, and knew almost nothing about it prior to the booking. We were very pleasantly surprised: the rooms are comfortable and well-appointed (though fairly small -- don't expect a lot of space), and the staff are helpful. I thought this hotel was a great combination of creature comforts, location, and good value. I would definitely recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: gretamv
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised during our stay. The staff was very nice and helpful, all spoke good English, the location was perfect for strolls down CHAMPS ELYSEES. We walked to the Eifel tower, the Louve, and a long walk to the Notre Dame - but really have to be enthusiastic about walking. Great breakfast buffet and afternoon tea table

Reviews.Title: “So glad that we chose to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Journeyer
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 6 night stay at this boutique hotel. Here is what we liked and will cause us to return: *Location, location, location. Convenient access, either by walking or metro, to places we planned to visit. *Sense of place. The public and guest rooms have an ambience and furnishings that are not homogenized that could be anywhere in the world. You get a sense, we're in Paris. *Quiet - able to get a good night's rest! With the sound proofed windows there was very little street noise and combined with the comfortable mattress, we were able to sleep. Ask for a room away from the elevator. *Friendly knowledgeable staff. The concierges were terrific. The staff in the breakfast and afternoon tea room were helpful and friendly. This human factor makes all the difference in the experience of a place. *Cleanliness of room. Good housekeeping. *Breakfast, afternoon tea as well as free soft drinks from the room’s mini-bar was included in our rate . The American style buffet breakfast and afternoon tea were nice spreads, beyond the bare boned basics. Coming back to the hotel after a day of site-seeing, it was pleasurable to have a drink and some goodies and decompress before the evening activities. *Internet wireless was free. I really don't like being charged extra for this and I really liked that it was included. *Availability of non-smoking rooms *Room size. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the rooms, having stayed on the Ile St Louis, Left Bank and 1st Arr where we had been in tiny rooms. We actually felt we had space.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AdamSandler056
Reviews.Content: Small, but friendly hotel in probably the best position i could have asked for in the price bracket. Very clean and very helpful staff. Rooms were moderate in size, but only to be expected in such a location. Walking distance of Arc d'Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, Louvre, Notre Dame and more. The free champagne, breakfast, mini bar and evening snacks/drinks were a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good services. A great choice.”
Reviews.Author: Fabiano_Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel in November/2010, for 4 nigths, with my child 2 years old. We have a very good experience with this hotel and with the stafs. We would recommend this hotel for all families traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient location for everything we wanted to do!”
Reviews.Author: Eileen066
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very welcoming and warm on a very cold weekend! Our room was pleasantly quiet and had everything we needed for an enjoyable stay in Paris. The hotel staff were all very helpful and ready to answer any queries and requests. Breakfast was adequate with a good choice of breads and pastries. The included buffet tea/supper is a good idea as the hotel does not have a restaurant although overall this was a little disappointing - the free glass of champagne was great though and was available on request! We were only a 20 minute walk from the Grand Palais and the Monet exhibition, the main reason for our trip! The Louvre and the Musee d'Orsay were also little more than a 30 minute wander down the Rue du Faubourg with all of its designer shops and outlets to browse "en route". The nearest Metro station is only a few minutes walk away and all in all, the hotel is everything it advertises to be - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great service.”
Reviews.Author: JackyBao
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, room fee including free breakfast, free afternoon tea(dinner), free minibar. The bed room is very tidy, the rest room is very modern & clean. Both breakfast & afternoon tea are very delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Godd Location”
Reviews.Author: Armen34
Reviews.Content: Th location of hotel is very good. Choice for breakfast is very rich. The speed of check-in and check-out is fantastic only problem is the size of the rooms. They are very small so you can hardly move in the roomwithout hitting somewhere. Apart from this I recomend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, good value room...”
Reviews.Author: SED916
Reviews.Content: After much searching for the best value hotel in Paris, we picked this hotel mainly for the price and for the extras. Included in the room rate was a complimentary breakfast, tea time buffet, free soft drinks in the mini bar and free glass of champagne. The breakfast buffet was really nice with lots of variety - breakfast room was a little cramped though. Bed was comfy, only one pillow though. Location was really good as you are only 10 minutes from L'Arc de Triomphe. Very helpful staff and the rooms were very clean. Really can't fault it... Will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful stay. Room very good but too high temperature. Breakfast room too small”
Reviews.Author: alvix
Reviews.Content: Beatiful stay. Room very good but too high temperature. Breakfast room too small. Location is ideal; near to center but quiet and comfortable. Professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “High quality in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bostonnative1234
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST Best Western ever. I upgraded to a larger room so we stayed at the top floor which had a great view of the Arc de Triomphe. The room was clean, comfortable, updated and spacious. The AC didn't work that well but we opened the windows. Breakfast and tea time offered a variety of delicious food. The hotel is 10 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe where you can hop on the subway or bus. There is even a shuttle bus, Air France that goes to Charles De Gulle Airport. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again and again. Don't forget to ask for your complimentary glass of champagne!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: threetuns48
Reviews.Content: Reception is small and sometimes unattended. Complimentary tea very good and a good choice of food for breakfast. Room facing main road a bit noisy at night but a very good and modern bathroom. Very clean. Only drawback was the distance to the metro, approx 400-500 m.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Deb500Midlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for my first visit to Paris. It was wonderful. The room wasn't particularly large but that's par for the course for Paris. Most importantly it was clean, had a lovely balcony with views of the arc de triomphe and was in a wonderful location. The free mini bar was a welcome bonus. The staff were all very pleasant - we were pointed in the direction of some excellent restaurants for dinner. I will definitely use the hotel again when I come for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming hotel. with great service”
Reviews.Author: Elomeda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over our return from overseas trip to USA in a newly renovated room, tiny but extra clean with bright nice bathroom. The room has a balcony with a view on the Arc De triumph. Our rate included free glass of champagne , mini bar, breakfast and can you believe even a snack like a dinner from 5.30pm onwards. Quite good value for money if you opt for all-inclusive deal : a tea time buffet of cold meats, breads and cakes and free WIFI. The staffs were excellent, all spoke English and nothing was too much trouble. I should mention them by name: D’Gamal, Osman, Sara, Sandrine and others for their charming friendly attitude. Thanks for good service. It really made our first visit to Paris so enjoyable and I would highly recommend and will stay there from now on whenever I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: gypsy003
Reviews.Content: We paid extra for the deluxe room but were given a standard room. We asked an employee when we saw the room if this was the deluxe & were told it was. After returning home, we saw on the Expedia .ca website that it was actually the standard room. When we wrote our review on Expedia's website, they edited it out our comments about this as well as the fact that Best Western would not give us their reward points since we booked through Expedia. Other than that the hotel was very nice & in a great location, just off the Champs Elysees & within walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe. We stayed almost a full week but only were able to have the included breakfast, once because the dining room was too small.

Reviews.Title: “Real Parisian charm”
Reviews.Author: CheerioAgogo
Reviews.Content: A good all round hotel in a great location. Quite good value for money if you opt for all inclusive deal - this included bed and breakfast, champagne on arrival, a tea time buffet of cold meats, breads and cakes and free WIFI. Helpful service. Beautiful room (stayed in 201)- very clean and tastefully decorated. Larger than I expected having read other reviews about the small size - it was more than adequate for a centrally located hotel! Lovely balcony and double doors - Parisan charm all over! Only downside is that the air-conditioning was broken in my room and Paris was very hot at this time! They had provided a fan though although it was not as good as aircon. Collegues had rooms with working aircon so it must just be this room at this time. Worth the sticky nights sleep though as overall a very good experience. I will be returning for pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: shyoung11
Reviews.Content: This was my third time in Paris and without a doubt the best hotel for the money. The location is fantastic!!! Close to two metro stops and short walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysee the location just couldn't get any better. The hotel itself was wonderful too. Our room was a great size for a four star hotel, very clean, and recently renovated. We were in a superiour room on a non smoking floor with windows facing three directions. the first room we were shown was across from the elevator. That one was dark without much natural light and felt cramped. Our room was completely different- filled with light and very spacious. The tea time buffet is now in the hotel itself (no longer need to go across the street) and was an awesome bonus. We could overhear some patrons occasionally complaining that it was the same every night or not enough for dinner but that was not the point of the buffet for us. The point was to have a quick snack to tide us over between a long day in paris and going out for dinner. Some cheese and meats to calm our hunger- not to satiate it! With that in mind, we loved having tea time in our hotel. The staff were very gracious and the hotel manager was beyond helpful. We were using best western gift cards from canada and when we went to pay with them they wouldn't work in his computer. he spent at least an hour (maybe more) on the phone with the international office (the paris office was closed) sorting it all out and never seemed agitated or annoyed about it. Also want to mention that the breakfast was great too. A real value. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but nice”
Reviews.Author: anisia25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days during our honeymoon. The cheaper rooms are tiny but very clean. Breakfast is boring and not much to eat. Overall very good experience. Would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: showster
Reviews.Content: We had booked in for 2 nights over the UK bank holiday weekend. Had a newly refurbished room and the bathroom was wonderful. What surprised me was that our rate included free glass of champagne , mini bar, breakfast and can you believe even a snack from 5.30pm onwards. The staff were excellent and all spoke english and nothing was too much trouble. I would only stay here from now on whenever I go to Paris. well done to sandrine and her team :)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: RobynU
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel. We had a corner room which was large, clean and very comfortable. We were on the top floor and the view from the balcony was great! The staff were very friendly and always greeted you when you walked in the door. The Breakfast was good. Both my husband and myself would recommend staying here to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: alaei
Reviews.Content: the room was comfortable and clean and all staff were friendly and helpful, excellent and historic location, good breakfast and tea-time buffet, We were pleasantly surprised and would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: backtoboogie
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel for my first trip to Paris with my adult daughter was a challenge. Not knowing the city, and reading the numerous reviews we decided to go with a chain that we were familiar with. We chose the Best Western Etoile Friedland because of it's proximity to the Champs Eleysee. We were greeted with the offer of a glass of champagne, and very pleasant front desk staff. The room we were given was larger than I expected. It was, however a smoking room that triggered an asthma attack through the night.... In the morning I explained the situation to the gentleman at the front desk, and he immediately made arrangements for us to move to a non-smoking floor. After partaking of the breakfast included with our room, we packed up and left for the day. When we returned we were guided to our new room and all luggage had been moved for us. The room was smaller, but no more problems. Part of our stay included afternoon tea at the hotel across the street, but we were not home at the right time to enjoy it. The staff here were helpful with taxis, directions and were extremely respectful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “stay 4 out of 5 nights had no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: vactrip99
Reviews.Content: In middle of Sept. around 80F inside the room had no AC unless you call the front desk and they only turn it on for a few minutes. We kept calling every night every few minutes. Very stingy on electricity and bath towels. Room is clean but if you absolutely had to sleep with air do not stay in this hotel after Aug. You can open the window but it is quite noisy. Our room was hot 5-10 degree hotter than outside. Free internet, breakfast, and drinks in the frig. 5 minutes to metro.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for shopping & metro”
Reviews.Author: ArgyK
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel very close to the champs elysee and the arc de triomph. 5 mins walk to the metro of the arc de triomp. Breakfast was ok, room was clean but not sure I would consider it a 4 * hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Fantastic Location (and free wi-fi!)”
Reviews.Author: Kasidie
Reviews.Content: Although we would rate this a 3 star hotel, not 4 as Hotels.com has it, we'd says it's a fantastic 3-star hotel. Very Parisian and cute, it sits at the intersection of several streets and has adorable views of the old buildings around it. And it is a very easy walk to the Champs, Louvre, Seine, etc. Also about a 10 min walk straight down Friedland street to the metro at the Arc De Triomphe if you'd like to travel that way (easiest way to/from the airport during rush hour). One thing though, as other reviewers have noted, the standard rooms are small. We mean REALLY small. Closet sized. We stayed in the next level upgrade and it was wonderful - nice bathroom, brightly lit, good windows, and large. So it's worth the extra $40 to upgrade (at least to us). The breakfast is 20E (so don't expect a free breakfast like a lot of European hotels offer). We can't testify about the quality of the breakfast though as we always party late and never wake up before noon, thus we never saw it. Best news is that there's free wireless internet, and it works great! Very, very rare, as most hotels charge quite a bit for it (we paid 25E a day at our next hotel on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Gazelle1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my boyfriend for a weekend break. It's a good hotel if, like us, you will spend most of your time exploring Paris, but did have some bad points. Good points: - Good location near to the Arc de Triomphe (although still a 10 - 15 minute walk to the nearest metro - George V) - Really nicely decorated room with a decent bathroom and balcony - Comfortable bed Bad points: - Staff weren't helpful and quite rude - When we checked in and got to our room (very late at night) one of the towels had been used and was covered in make up and the soap had been opened and used. So the next morning we had to share one towel between us. Generally a decent hotel, as long as you're not planning on spending much time there!

Reviews.Title: “anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: gwilty1964
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, but stunned this is a 4 star hotel, very small bedroom, very small breakfast area (although breakfast was good) no where to have a drink or eat in hotel for dinner or evening etc no parking with hotel, they recommend under ground city parking. Reception staff were pleasant until we kicked up a fuss because they could not offer us the room that was pre booked and payed in full. Breakfast was20 euros per person

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GemR
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the last two nights of a French holiday with my husband after finding a good deal on their website. When we arrived on a hot April day (27 degrees) we hoped to leave the car in the undercover car park and head off to explore Paris. Instead, when we arrived the woman behind the reception desk told us that the air con was broken so no-one could stay in the hotel. She had arranged for us to stay in another hotel in the outskirts of Paris. When I pointed out that the Best Western chain own over 80 hotels in Paris two of which were across the road I requested a hotel nearer to town. After 30 minutes and a great deal of persuasion she finally found a room at the Best Western Lorette Opera where the staff were actually helpful however we had to park on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Paris Location”
Reviews.Author: Jaimephx
Reviews.Content: This nicely appointment smaller hotel is within walking distance of all the sites. A comfortable room a bit pricey for the amenities but there would be no complaints about the stay had the bathroom ceiling had not leaked heavily and the staff made no attempt to move us to a differnt room or hotel. We also recieved no discount nor complimentaries for the major inconvenience.Still though no views, the central location was perfect for those who like to stroll in Paris and take in the sites,city, and yummy pasiries in the cafes.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Champs-Elysees Friedland
HotelInfo.Address: 177 Rue Du Faubourg Saint-Honore, 75008 Paris, France
